intro: Psychotria costivenia subsp. altorum, commonly known as the highland psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. This subspecies is characterized by its erect growth habit and dark green, elliptical leaves. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have a red or purple calyx. It is often found in humid, shaded environments at higher altitudes.
